intro: Vernonella acrocephala, commonly known as the common vervain, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, featuring slender stems and opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, two-lipped, violet-blue flowers that bloom from summer to autumn. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Vernonella acrocephala is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
